article_text: Kansas Gov. Sam Brownback said he was neither for nor against expanding Medicaid, the health care program for the poor, “if it meets his own personal financial concerns.” But he said if he was presented with a proposal to expand Medicaid in Kansas, he would likely sign the bill.

article_metadata.news-keywords: brownback, kansas, Medicaid expansion, hospitals, uninsured, Obamacare

article_metadata.title: Gov. Sam Brownback shows courage with a softening stance on Medicaid | The Kansas City Star

article_summary:
Kansas Gov.
Sam Brownback said he was neither for nor against expanding Medicaid, the health care program for the poor, “if it meets his own personal financial concerns.” But he said if he was presented with a proposal to expand Medicaid in Kansas, he would likely sign the bill.
